Sentencas: High temperature water electrolysis with solid oxide electrolysis cells (SOECs) is a promising method for hydrogen production.
Titulo: Performance and degradation of an SOEC stack with different cell components

Sentencas: In order to study the performance and degradation behavior of cells with different cell components in electrolysis mode, a four-cell stack was assembled that used JULICH's F10 design with two types of air electrodes based on La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-delta (LSC) and La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-delta (LSCF).
Titulo: Performance and degradation of an SOEC stack with different cell components

Sentencas: A PVD-prepared GDC layer was applied to LSCF cells while a screen-printing GDC layer was used in the LSC cells.
Titulo: Performance and degradation of an SOEC stack with different cell components

Sentencas: The performance of the stack was first characterized with IV-curve measurements in both SOFC and SOEC modes within the temperature range of 700-800 degrees C.
Titulo: Performance and degradation of an SOEC stack with different cell components

Sentencas: The durability of the stack was investigated by conducting a long-term stationary electrolysis operation with a constant current density of -0.5 Acm(-2) and steam conversion rate of 50% at 800 degrees C. Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy (EIS) was used to study the electrochemical performance of the stack, as well as the degradation behavior during long-term electrolysis operation.
Titulo: Performance and degradation of an SOEC stack with different cell components

Sentencas: The method Distribution of Relaxation Times (DRT) was applied for the further analysis of the EIS data, and the DRT results have successfully supported the stack degradation analysis.
Titulo: Performance and degradation of an SOEC stack with different cell components
